bibl.title: Letter from Tom D. Spies to Philip Showalter Hench, November 7, 1953

div1.p: Spies inquires if Hench has received his Finlay Medal yet. He writes that he is Hench's Cuban representative and hopes that Hench is his representative at the Mayo Foundation.

div1.head: Letter from Tom D. Spies to Philip Showalter Hench, November 7, 1953

Dear Phil:
div1.p:
Didn't you actually get the Carlos Finlay medal? I know all the
to-do and strange things that happen but I thought you did get the medal. Anyway
this is another one and I am sure you will in time get it.

Incidentally, I'm your Cuban representative as I hope you are mine
at the Mayo Foundation.
I'm sure this new medal has been voted for you.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, Tom D. Spies, M. D. TDS/mo
